text:
<!channel> - 

First and foremost, fantastic job yesterday. These informal check ins are getting more and more formal as time goes by. Really amazing to see the product come together on so many fronts — Yes interaction design & visuals, but also tone, point of view, purpose, and opportunities. 

I can’t tell you how much I loved the discussion around profile. The debate about white space — really a debate around modernism and editorial voice — was priceless. As you’re continuing work, keep that moment and thought in mind. 

All that said, we have a continued pace we need to keep up today and throughout the week. As you heard yesterday, we have some great momentum. In large part, the most major shifts discussed yesterday were copy changes — Which is amazing! 

Please keep it up today. We have quite a bit to get through, tidy up, and understand for our *Friday delivery*. 

As with my note yesterday - holler with questions, concerns, blocks, etc. More importantly, holler with good stuff too! I know it’s difficult to see the good in the pushes like this. Give props where you see them. And keep in active communication. 

I’m here all day if anybody wants to bounce stuff off of me. 

Thanks and keep it up!
:facepunch::skin-tone-3::clap::skin-tone-4:

Also we chatted a bit after our meeting, and to help us make our deadline but also make sure the designs are cohesive, if everyone could make sure they are updating their type to follow the type style guide as they work through any feedback, that would be great. Thanks!
:point_up_2:

As part of that, please check in with Matt for any random questions along the way. I know everybody’s work is pretty close — but if you have a question on which button to use, the type style for that new bit of type, etc — Matt’s there for cohesion on the AD front. Thanks!

I wanted to ask about our internal Dx visual check in on friday morning before the external review. do we still want to plan on that or do we think the informal desk check ins sure to happen between now and then will keep the team updated just as well?

It’s always a little hard to predict to be honest. I’d love to nix it and give you guys more time to work, but at this point i think it’s too tough to call. can we keep it on the books and see tomorrow end of day if it’s still needed?
yeah that’s fine, like always i can definitely be on board with it, just trying to find more time to design knowing our tight schedule. ultimately it comes down to what we all need.
#downforwhatever
oops forgot to hit send on this - absolutely and thanks for bringing it up trent. let’s check in EOD thurs and make a call.

<!channel> Yesterday we were chatting about what developers may need to build the designs and it reminded me of Zeplin, which creates spec with Sketch files so I did some research to see if there’s a similar tool for Photodshop files. Not sure if this is something we’ll want to try out, but thought I’d pass along the link in case we’re interested and we feel like it may save time/effort. <http://marklyapp.com/>

attachments.title: Markly App - the best Spec App/Plugin for Sketch & Adobe Photoshop CC
attachments.text: Markly is a fun way to create and design specs for your design works. It is maded for today's web and mobile designers, with Adobe Photoshop CC & Sketch supported. Best Sketch / Photoshop spec plugin!
attachments.fallback: Markly App: Markly App - the best Spec App/Plugin for Sketch & Adobe Photoshop CC

text: Zeplin is the way to go. I use it. Developers love it
Zeplin has photoshop integration now
Ohh I didn’t realize that, I thought it was for Sketch only
In that case, here’s the link for Zeplin. Sounds highly recommended from lots of folks:
<https://zeplin.io/>

attachments.title: Zeplin
attachments.text: Collaboration app for UI designers and frontend developers

text: They integrated photoshop maybe a couple months ago. Might still be in beta but it's in every email blast they do. I use sketch so don't keep up on ps as much
Ah, it’s beta
<https://medium.com/zeplin-gazette/photoshop-open-beta-now-3f8f502fc4de#.3p4frsk93>

attachments.title: Photoshop open beta, now! — Zeplin Gazette
attachments.text: We’ve been alpha testing Zeplin’s Photoshop plugin for a while now. It’s time to release the beta to the masses! :cocktail:
attachments.fallback: Medium: Photoshop open beta, now! — Zeplin Gazette

text: <@U026E0ZNR|trent> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/trent/F1RGHQM5L/screen_shot_2016-07-13_at_2.58.59_pm.png|Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 2.58.59 PM.png> and commented: Not sure how much organizing it’d take but new PS offered to automatically create a CC library from the type style guide PSD and gave me this. Pretty cool at first glance. If I’m able to organize it in a useful way I’ll share it to the rest of the team

initial_comment.comment: Not sure how much organizing it’d take but new PS offered to automatically create a CC library from the type style guide PSD and gave me this. Pretty cool at first glance. If I’m able to organize it in a useful way I’ll share it to the rest of the team

text: if only we still had a design intern
damn. that’s a lot of character styles...
i’m wondering how many are duplicates
gotta be
Question for the Dx crew: What scale are you printing your screens?
we’ve been printing comps at 30% scale out of the Preview app

awesome. i like that it keeps it consistent with longer screens. Thinking about the meeting yesterday (specifically crowding around Ali’s profile), wondering if it’s too late to try and increase that a little bit across the board?
before we have 20 screens posted and realize they could be bigger
<@U026E0ZNR> ^ thoughts?
apologies if this is an annoying question

i think we’ve been printing at this scale to get closest to actual phone size. also so that we can fit many of the dif versions/screens side by side to see flow, etc.

that being said, if we’d prefer to use print outs for group presentations we can def bump up the scale. i’m totally down with that if you think it’s a better idea. i suppose i’ve been presenting with materials that were more meant for internal accounts hoping clients could follow along
good call. let’s keep it at 30% for accounting/comparison sake. Printouts on a board aren’t great for presentations at any scale. Thanks!
